body:
I'm posting this here to send a message to those involved: I apologize if I annoyed the crap out of you earlier. I have a horrible tendency make things a way bigger deal than they ought to be. I'm still not completely over it but I know it's not a huge deal (for now). If something like this happens again feel free to block me for a few days.

Here's the content of the post for context:

---

I overreacted. There is nothing devious going on as of now, and if there ever is I will make an update (which is likely to be the case in a few years, as history has proven a few times already).

A lot of this stems from things that were discussed in the Discord server that made it look like certain users had access to special information. Since Discord sucks, I am unable to join, so I was unaware of this (really, Ruqqus needs to abandon Discord; I'm sure I'm far from the only one, and you miss a lot of what Ruqqus has to offer without being able to go on the server).

To be fair to myself, the admins do seem to always be recruiting @AngstKitten and @Meguminnnn for every single role they need filled. I am not sure why or what the admins see in them that sets these two apart from anyone else to the admins, but the combination of that and information shared in the Discord server that I didn't know about made it seem like there was something deeper going on. I guess I'm forgetting that this isn't reddit anymore.

I'm still a bit concerned about the admins' decision to select the same two users over and over again for everything (maybe @captainmeta4 or @kek could clear this up for me), as that's what started the cabal on reddit, but it's not causing any trouble here as of yet and all of them are trustworthy afaik. The bigger problem right now is moving the Ruqqus discussion channels off of Discord and into a more accessible place. As it is now, there are too many miscommunications occurring and only those on Discord can stay informed. Ruqqus also lacks a DMing feature, so you need Discord for that too, including talking to the admins.
body_html:
I'm posting this here to send a message to those involved: I apologize if I annoyed the crap out of you earlier. I have a horrible tendency make things a way bigger deal than they ought to be. I'm still not completely over it but I know it's not a huge deal (for now). If something like this happens again feel free to block me for a few days.

Here's the content of the post for context:

I overreacted. There is nothing devious going on as of now, and if there ever is I will make an update (which is likely to be the case in a few years, as history has proven a few times already).

A lot of this stems from things that were discussed in the Discord server that made it look like certain users had access to special information. Since Discord sucks, I am unable to join, so I was unaware of this (really, Ruqqus needs to abandon Discord; I'm sure I'm far from the only one, and you miss a lot of what Ruqqus has to offer without being able to go on the server).

To be fair to myself, the admins do seem to always be recruiting @AngstKitten and @Meguminnnn for every single role they need filled. I am not sure why or what the admins see in them that sets these two apart from anyone else to the admins, but the combination of that and information shared in the Discord server that I didn't know about made it seem like there was something deeper going on. I guess I'm forgetting that this isn't reddit anymore.

I'm still a bit concerned about the admins' decision to select the same two users over and over again for everything (maybe @captainmeta4 or @kek could clear this up for me), as that's what started the cabal on reddit, but it's not causing any trouble here as of yet and all of them are trustworthy afaik. The bigger problem right now is moving the Ruqqus discussion channels off of Discord and into a more accessible place. As it is now, there are too many miscommunications occurring and only those on Discord can stay informed. Ruqqus also lacks a DMing feature, so you need Discord for that too, including talking to the admins.

body:
You raise a very valid question. But you can be sure because the admins haven't appointed me to any special positions. These two users were specifically sought out to help the admins in their work, and no one else was even told about it (the most visible examples were guildmastering WRD and being mods of the *official* Ruqqus Discord server). It's not become a problem yet, but it still makes me angry when this kind of stuff happens. It feels like the admins are playing favorites and being unfair to everyone else. Personally I think these privileges should be open for everyone to be considered or limited to admins only. Because as soon as you begin giving anyone preferential treatment, you end up exactly like reddit and digg. It's not yet a huge problem, and I don't blame the admins because nepotism is natural and inevitable, and I'm sure I'm plenty guilty of it myself. The admins probably don't even realize they're doing it. But when people who *aren't admins* are given any authority or positions that are typically reserved for admins, that is a form of corruption. It may not cause any obvious issues at first, but over time they become more and more prideful of themselves, and when they begin seeing themselves as greater than others that's when their minds justify censorship. I know this because I've been researching DefaultMods on reddit for the past 2 years, and that's how it got started. The Ruqqus admins just need to be a lot more careful about how they operate these things imo. Making a limit on how many guilds you can mod isn't going to magically stop a power user clique from forming; in fact it will hinder the ability for users to foster their own guilds, possibly making the problem *worse*.

So far there are only these 2 users beside the admins in this not-yet-cabal. I think we should call them "modmins" because they're basically moderators of all of Ruqqus, not full admin but have been given lots of authority.

It's not become a problem yet, but it still makes me angry when this kind of stuff happens. It feels like the admins are playing favorites and being unfair to everyone else. Personally I think these privileges should be open for everyone to be considered or limited to admins only. Because as soon as you begin giving anyone preferential treatment, you end up exactly like reddit and digg. It's not yet a huge problem, and I don't blame the admins because nepotism is natural and inevitable, and I'm sure I'm plenty guilty of it myself. The admins probably don't even realize they're doing it. But when people who aren't admins are given any authority or positions that are typically reserved for admins, that is a form of corruption. It may not cause any obvious issues at first, but over time they become more and more prideful of themselves, and when they begin seeing themselves as greater than others that's when their minds justify censorship. I know this because I've been researching DefaultMods on reddit for the past 2 years, and that's how it got started. The Ruqqus admins just need to be a lot more careful about how they operate these things imo. Making a limit on how many guilds you can mod isn't going to magically stop a power user clique from forming; in fact it will hinder the ability for users to foster their own guilds, possibly making the problem worse.

So far there are only these 2 users beside the admins in this not-yet-cabal. I think we should call them "modmins" because they're basically moderators of all of Ruqqus, not full admin but have been given lots of authority.
